job description:
Data Analyst
  • Conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design.
  • Develop analysis and reporting capabilities.
  • Monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Implementation data visualization reports and dashboards using industry known tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
  • Work with management to collect and prioritize business and information needs.
  • Work as a consultant with our clients nationwide.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
  • Utilize technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, machine learning, and segmentation techniques.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), and databases (SQL etc.).
  • Utilize knowledge of statistics.
  • Utilize strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Education: Master of Science in Data Science, Predictive Analytics, or equivalent degree. Experience: 1 year in the job offered or as a data analyst, business data analyst, or Analytics Consultant; documented experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets and working with big data; and 2 years in project and client engagement and direct customer service.

Tools: Hadoop, Power BI and Tableau. Technologies utilized: Business Objects, SQL, Excel, SPSS, SAS, R, Python.

SALARY: $87,090.00

LOCATION OF JOB: Synoptek, LLC, 19520 Jamboree Road, Suite 110, Irvine (Orange County), California 92612

Application is by Resume only. For consideration, email resume to Kristen Diet at kdietz@synoptek.com. This position qualifies for our Employee Referral Program.
